newsitem.title: UK: DMG says not obliged to bid for Sysdeco.
newsitem.headline: DMG says not obliged to bid for Sysdeco.

text.p: Deutsche Morgan Grenfell said it and its parent, Deutsche Bank AG, would not be obliged to bid for Norwegian software company Sysdeco Group by the Oslo Stock Exchange.
DMG unit Morgan Grenfell Asset Management owns 20.7 percent of Sysdeco while Deutsche has 26.7 percent.
A spokesman for DMG said the Oslo stock exchange had decided to treat the two holdings, amounting to 47.4 percent, as seperate.
Under Oslo exchange rules, a holding of over 45 percent can oblige the holder to make a formal bid for the company in question.
The large stakes had been built up mostly by MGAM fund manager Peter Young who has since been fired and is under investigation by Britain's Serious Fraud Office.

After the irregularities in the MGAM funds came to light in September, MGAM/Deutsche found they owned 51.2 percent of Sysdeco but have since cut their holdings. -- Joe Ortiz, London Newsroom +44 171 542 8864
